content:
Heya, in the past few weeks and months I haven't been as active as I used to. I think this is mostly due to WFH habits and a lot of other things going on right now. So, instead of dragging along pending reviews, I think it's better if I take myself off of the reviewer list for a while.
I opened a highfive PR here: https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/pull/295
Stay healthy everyone :heart:

Can you go through the PRs assigned to you and reassign them please? But keep in mind, that @Manish Goregaokar and I also have some real life stuff going on right now and are struggeling to get our reviews in. @Eduardo Broto already has 11 PRs assigned to him and tries his best to get through them. @llogiq hasn't had many PRs assigned to him, since he came back as a reviewer, so he might be happy to get some :)
I'm also changing jobs at the moment, so I've been a bit more busy lately. Luckily october will end soon... :smile:
Yeah, we've got a lot of PRs coming in, compared to the people we have doing reviews. I'm trying to review some of mine and re-assign the rest :)
I wonder if it would make sense for highfive to have a configurable maximum amout of pending reviews per reviewer to avoid overburdening people?

configurable maximum

Then you end up with prs with no assigned reviewer :/
At some point you just have more prs than people
do we have a dashboard with that data?... assigned PRs/unsigned, sum by reviewers...

Not really a dashboard, but you can use GitHub filters to get these numbers:
Here https://github.com/pulls?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Apr+assignee%3Aflip1995+archived%3Afalse+ you can filter by assignee over all repos
Or if you're only interested in one repo, you can filter PRs there by Assignee: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pulls/assigned/flip1995

Happy to report that taking an actual break is a good idea :joy:
I opened a PR to re-add myself again: https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/pull/303
